gov.lanl.util
Class ConfigurationManager

java.lang.Object
  gov.lanl.util.ConfigurationManager

public class ConfigurationManager
extends java.lang.Object

Class for reading the Djatoka system configuration. The main configuration is read in as properties from a standard properties file. Email templates and configuration files for other tools are also be accessed via this class.

The main configuration is by default read from the resource /djatoka.cfg. To specify a different configuration, the system property djatoka.configuration should be set to the filename of the configuration file.

Other configuration files are read from the config directory of the Djatoka installation directory.

Version:
$Revision: 4243 $
Author:
Fabio N. Kepler - Modifications for use with Djatoka., Robert Tansley, Larry Stone - Interpolated values., Mark Diggory - General Improvements to detection, logging and loading.

loadConfig

public static void loadConfig(java.lang.String configFile)
Load the Djatoka configuration properties. Only does anything if properties are not already loaded. Properties are loaded in from the specified file, or default locations.

Parameters:
configFile - The djatoka.cfg configuration file to use, or null to try default locations

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
Command-line interface for running configuration tasks. Possible arguments:
  • -property name prints the value of the property name from djatoka.cfg to the standard output. If the property does not exist, nothing is written.

Parameters:
argv - command-line arguments
